what-is-a-stock.title: Stock kya hai?
what-is-a-stock.description: Chalo, bilkul basics se shuru karte hain. Stock kya hai aur yeh market ka fundamental building block kyun hai, yeh samjho.
what-is-a-stock.simpleDefinitionP1: Essentially, ek stock (jise share ya equity bhi kehte hain) ek type ki security hai jo ek corporation mein ownership signify karti hai aur corporation ke assets aur earnings ke ek hisse par claim represent karti hai.
what-is-a-stock.simpleDefinitionP2: Saral shabdon mein, jab aap kisi company ka stock khareedte hain, to aap us company ka ek chota sa tukda khareed rahe hote hain. Aap ek part-owner, ya shareholder ban jaate hain.
what-is-a-stock.ownershipVisualP1: Pizza ka har slice company ke stock ka ek share represent karta hai.
what-is-a-stock.ownershipVisualP2: Jab aap ek share khareedte hain, to aap us pizza ka ek slice khareed rahe hote hain. Aap ek part-owner ban jaate hain!
what-is-a-stock.whyCompaniesIssue: Companies stock kyun issue karti hain?
what-is-a-stock.whyCompaniesIssueP1: Companies fun ke liye ownership nahi de deti. Woh stock ek primary reason ke liye issue karti hain: capital (paisa) raise karne ke liye.
what-is-a-stock.fundingGrowthP: Ek company ko naye factories banane, naye products develop karne, naye markets mein expand karne, ya aur logon ko hire karne ke liye paiso ki zaroorat ho sakti hai. Stock bechne se debt mein jaaye bina yeh sab karne ke liye cash mil jaata hai.
what-is-a-stock.goingPublicP: Jab ek private company pehli baar apne shares public ko bechti hai, to use Initial Public Offering (IPO) kehte hain. Yeh ek major event hai jo badi matra mein capital raise kar sakta hai aur company ki prestige aur public profile badha sakta hai.
what-is-a-stock.whyPeopleBuyP: Investors profit kamane ki expectation se stock khareedte hain, jo do main tarikon se ho sakta hai:
what-is-a-stock.capitalGainsP: Agar company achha perform karti hai, to uski value badhti hai, aur uske stock ki price bhi. Fir aap apne shares unki khareedi hui keemat se zyada mein bech sakte hain. Is profit ko capital gain kehte hain.
what-is-a-stock.dividendsP: Kuch companies apne profits ka ek hissa apne shareholders ke saath share karti hain. In payments ko dividends kehte hain. Yeh investors ko ek regular income stream provide karte hain.
what-is-a-stock.takeaway1: Ek stock company mein ownership represent karta hai.
what-is-a-stock.takeaway2: Companies growth aur operations ke liye paisa raise karne ke liye stock issue karti hain.
what-is-a-stock.takeaway3: Investors potentially capital gains aur dividends ke zariye paisa kamane ke liye stock khareedte hain.
what-is-a-stock.takeaway4: Stock own karne ka matlab hai aap ek shareholder hain aur company ke assets par aapka claim hai.
what-is-a-stock.term1: Shareholder: Ek individual ya institution jo company mein shares own karta hai.
what-is-a-stock.term2: IPO (Initial Public Offering): Pehli baar jab ek private company apne shares public ko offer karti hai.
what-is-a-stock.term3: Capital Gains: Ek investment ki sale se hua profit.
what-is-a-stock.term4: Dividends: Ek company ki earnings ka ek portion jo uske shareholders ko pay kiya jaata hai.

different-types-of-stocks.title: Alag Alag Tarah ke Stocks
different-types-of-stocks.description: Sabhi stocks ek jaise nahi hote. Yeh lesson aapko stocks ki alag-alag categories se introduce karega, jisse aap unke unique characteristics aur risk profiles ko samajh payenge.

commonVsPreferred.title: Common vs. Preferred Stocks
commonVsPreferred.p1: Common Stock: Jab log stocks ke baare mein baat karte hain to zyada tar yahi matlab hota hai. Yeh voting rights deta hai, jisse shareholders ko company ke decisions mein apni baat kehne ka mauka milta hai. Common stockholders ko dividends mil sakte hain, lekin yeh guaranteed nahi hain.
commonVsPreferred.p2: Preferred Stock: In stocks mein aam taur par voting rights nahi hote. Lekin, yeh typically ek fixed dividend pay karte hain jo common stock dividends se pehle pay kiya jaata hai. Liquidation ke case mein, preferred stockholders ka company assets par zyada claim hota hai.

byMarketCap.title: Market Capitalization ke Hisab se Classification
byMarketCap.p1: Large-Cap Stocks: Yeh badi, well-established companies ke stocks hain jinka market capitalization $10 billion se zyada hai. Inhe aam taur par kam risky mana jaata hai.
byMarketCap.p2: Mid-Cap Stocks: Yeh un companies ke stocks hain jinka market capitalization $2 billion se $10 billion ke beech hai. Yeh growth potential aur stability ka balance offer karte hain.
byMarketCap.p3: Small-Cap Stocks: Yeh chhoti companies ke stocks hain jinka market capitalization $300 million se $2 billion ke beech hai. Inme high growth potential hota hai lekin high risk bhi hota hai.

byStyle.title: Investment Style ke Hisab se Classification
byStyle.p1: Growth Stocks: Yeh un companies ke stocks hain jinke market mein average se zyada rate se grow karne ki umeed hai. Yeh aksar dividends nahi dete, kyunki yeh expansion ke liye earnings ko reinvest karte hain.
byStyle.p2: Value Stocks: Yeh aise stocks hain jo apne fundamentals, jaise ki earnings, sales, aur book value ke comparison mein kam price par trade karte hain. Yeh aksar investors dwara nazarandaaz kiye jaate hain aur undervalued ho sakte hain.

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
keyTakeaways.item1: Stocks ko broadly common aur preferred stocks mein categorize kiya ja sakta hai, har ek ke alag rights aur benefits hote hain.
keyTakeaways.item2: Market capitalization (large-cap, mid-cap, small-cap) ek stock ke risk aur growth potential ko assess karne mein ek key factor hai.
keyTakeaways.item3: Investment style (growth vs. value) investors ko apne financial goals aur risk tolerance ke saath apne stock choices align karne mein help karta hai.

what-is-a-stock-market.title: Stock Market kya hai?
what-is-a-stock-market.description: Us central marketplace ko discover karein jahan stocks khareede aur beche jaate hain, aur economy mein uske vital role ko samjhein.

analogy.title: Ek Simple Analogy: The Supermarket
analogy.p1: Stock market ko ek giant, well-organized supermarket ki tarah socho. Lekin fruits, vegetables, aur groceries bechne ke bajaye, yeh publicly listed companies ke stocks (ownership ke tukde) bechta hai.

supermarket.title: Ek Supermarket...
supermarket.p: Buyers (shoppers) ko sellers (farmers, brands) se connect karta hai.

stockMarket.title: Ek Stock Market...
stockMarket.p: Buyers (investors) ko sellers (dusre investors ya companies) se connect karta hai.

coreFunctions.title: Stock Market ke Core Functions
coreFunctions.p1: Stock market do primary functions serve karta hai jo economy ke liye crucial hain:

item1.title: Buyers aur Sellers ko Connect Karna
item1.p: Yeh ek centralized, regulated, aur transparent platform provide karta hai jahan jo log stock khareedna chahte hain woh aasani se unhe bechne walon ko dhoond sakte hain. Isse liquidity create hoti hai, jisse investments mein enter aur exit karna aasan ho jaata hai.

item2.title: Capital Formation ko Facilitate Karna
item2.p: Yeh companies ko public ko ownership stakes (stocks) bechkar paisa (capital) raise karne ki anumati deta hai. Is capital ko fir business grow karne, jobs create karne, aur innovate karne ke liye use kiya jaata hai.

takeaways.item1: Stock market stocks khareedne aur bechne ke liye ek centralized marketplace hai.
takeaways.item2: Yeh liquidity provide karta hai, jisse stocks trade karna aasan ho jaata hai.
takeaways.item3: Yeh capital formation ke liye crucial hai, companies ko grow karne ke liye paisa raise karne mein help karta hai.

how-stocks-are-traded.title: Stocks Kaise Trade Hote Hain
how-stocks-are-traded.description: Primary aur secondary markets ke beech ke difference ko samajhne ke liye behind the scenes jaayein, aur har transaction mein involved key players ko jaanein.

primarySecondary.title: Primary vs. Secondary Markets
primarySecondary.p1: Stock trading do alag-alag markets mein hoti hai:

primary.title: The Primary Market
primary.p: Yahan stocks paida hote hain. Jab ek company Initial Public Offering (IPO) hold karti hai, to woh apne shares સીधे investors ko pehli baar bechti hai. Paisa સીधे company ko jaata hai.

secondary.title: The Secondary Market
secondary.p: Ise hi hum aam taur par 'the stock market' kehte hain. Yahan investors company ke involvement ke bina aapas mein stocks trade karte hain. Price supply aur demand se determine hoti hai.

exchanges.title: Stock Exchanges
exchanges.p: Yeh organized marketplaces hain jahan trading hoti hai. India mein, do main exchanges hain National Stock Exchange (NSE) aur Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

brokers.title: Brokers
brokers.p: Retail investors exchange par સીधे trade nahi kar sakte. Unhe apne behalf par trades execute karne ke liye ek licensed intermediary chahiye jise stockbroker (jaise Zerodha, Upstox, etc.) kehte hain.

takeaways.item1: Primary Market naye stocks (IPOs) ke liye hai, jahan paisa company ko jaata hai.
takeaways.item2: Secondary Market woh jagah hai jahan investors ek dusre ke saath existing stocks trade karte hain.
takeaways.item3: Aapko NSE aur BSE jaise major stock exchanges par trade karne ke liye ek broker ki zaroorat hai.

reading-a-stock-quote.title: Stock Quote Padhna
reading-a-stock-quote.description: Ek stock ke performance aur valuation ko jaldi se samajhne ke liye stock quote mein numbers aur symbols ko decode karna seekhein.
reading-a-stock-quote.intro: Ek stock quote ek stock ki essential financial information ka ek snapshot hai. Yeh pehli baar mein numbers ka jumble lag sakta hai, lekin ek baar aapko pata chal jaaye ki kya dekhna hai, to ise samajhna aasan hai.
reading-a-stock-quote.imageCaption: Ek fictional company, 'Innovate Corp.' ke liye ek typical stock quote.

price.def: Stock ke ek share ke liye current market price.

change.def: Pichle din ke close se stock ki price mein change, jo absolute value aur percentage dono mein dikhaya gaya hai.

volume.def: Current din ke dauran trade hue total shares ki sankhya. High volume high interest indicate karta hai.

marketCap.def: Company ke sabhi shares ki total value. Iski calculation stock price ko total number of shares se multiply karke ki jaati hai.

takeaways.item1: Ek stock quote ek stock ke current trading data ka ek quick summary provide karta hai.
takeaways.item2: Key metrics mein price, change, volume, aur market cap shaamil hain.
takeaways.item3: In terms ko samajhna ek stock ke performance ko analyze karne ka pehla step hai.

bull-vs-bear-markets.title: Bull vs. Bear Markets
bull-vs-bear-markets.description: Do major market trends aur unhe define karne wale investor sentiment ko samjhein.
bull-vs-bear-markets.intro: Aap aksar commentators ko 'bull' aur 'bear' markets ke baare mein baat karte sunenge. Yeh terms market ki overall direction aur mood ko describe karte hain.

bear.title: Bear Market
bear.subtitle: Market sust pada hai.
bear.char1: Prices gir rahi hain (typically 20% ya usse zyada)

takeaways.item1: Ek Bull Market badhti prices aur optimism se characterized hota hai.
takeaways.item2: Ek Bear Market girti prices aur pessimism se characterized hota hai.
takeaways.item3: Yeh trends cyclical hain aur market ka ek natural part hain.

market-indices.title: Market Indices (Sensex & Nifty)
market-indices.description: Jaanein ki market indices stock market ki overall health ke liye ek barometer ke roop mein kaise kaam karte hain.
market-indices.intro: Ek market index stocks ke ek specific group ke performance ka ek statistical measure hai. Yeh market ki health aur direction ka ek snapshot provide karta hai. India mein, do sabse famous indices hain:

sensex.title: BSE Sensex
sensex.p1: Sensex Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) ka benchmark index hai.
sensex.p2: Ismein exchange par 30 sabse bade aur sabse actively-traded stocks shaamil hain, jo overall market ka ek sample provide karte hain.

nifty.title: NSE Nifty 50
nifty.p1: Nifty 50 National Stock Exchange (NSE) ka benchmark index hai.
nifty.p2: Ismein 50 sabse badi Indian companies shaamil hain, jo economy ke ek broad cross-section ko represent karti hain.

takeaways.item1: Sensex aur Nifty jaise market indices overall market ke liye ek barometer ke roop mein kaam karte hain.
takeaways.item2: BSE Sensex 30 major stocks ko track karta hai.
takeaways.item3: NSE Nifty 50 50 major stocks ko track karta hai.

role-of-sebi.title: SEBI ka Role
role-of-sebi.description: Indian stock market ke watchdog se milo: Securities and Exchange Board of India.
role-of-sebi.intro: Stock market ek free-for-all nahi hai. Yeh ek highly regulated environment hai, aur India mein chief regulator SEBI (Securities and Exchange Board of India) hai.

item1.title: Investors ko Protect Karna
item1.p: Yeh sunishchit karna ki market fair hai aur investors ke saath cheat nahi hota hai.

item2.title: Market ko Develop Karna
item2.p: Securities market ke growth aur health ko promote karna.

item3.title: Intermediaries ko Regulate Karna
item3.p: Brokers, exchanges, aur dusre players ke conduct ko oversee karna.

takeaways.item1: SEBI Indian securities market ka main regulator hai.
takeaways.item2: Iska core mission investors ko protect karna hai.
takeaways.item3: SEBI market fair, transparent, aur efficient ho, yeh sunishchit karne ke liye rules set karta hai.

stockMarketCourse.title: Stock Market Course
stockMarketCourse.description: Ek savvy investor banne ka aapka safar yahan se shuru hota hai.

module1.title: Module 1: The Basics
module1.description: Stock market ke fundamental concepts aur uske components ko seekhein.

module2.title: Module 2: Market Kaise Kaam Karta Hai
module2.description: Stock market ko shape dene wali forces aur entities ko samjhein.

module3.title: Module 3: Market Mein Aapke Pehle Kadam
module3.description: Ek naye investor ko unki trading journey shuru karne ke liye practical, step-by-step guide provide karna.

module4.title: Module 4: Stock Selection ki Kala: Fundamental Analysis
module4.description: Learner ko ek company ki financial health analyze karne aur uski intrinsic value determine karne ke skills se equip karna.

module5.title: Module 5: Timing ka Vigyan: Technical Analysis
module5.description: Price action aur volume ke aadhar par market trends aur potential trading opportunities ko pehchanne ke liye technical analysis ke principles ko introduce karna.

module6.title: Module 6: Advanced Instruments aur Strategies
module6.description: Hedging aur speculation mein unke primary uses ke liye financial derivatives (futures aur options) ka introduction provide karna.

module7.title: Module 7: Ek Resilient Portfolio Banana aur Manage Karna
module7.description: Ek long-term investment portfolio banane, manage karne, aur maintain karne ke liye ek holistic approach mein sabhi seekhe gaye concepts ko synthesize karna.

opening-a-demat-and-trading-account.title: Demat aur Trading Account Kholna
opening-a-demat-and-trading-account.description: Stock market mein aapka pravesh dwar. Yeh lesson India mein investing aur trading shuru karne ke liye zaroori do essential accounts ko break down karta hai.
opening-a-demat-and-trading-account.intro: Aap apna pehla stock khareedne ya bechne se pehle, aapko do key accounts set up karne honge. Woh complex lag sakte hain, lekin woh bahut alag aur saral uddeshyon ki purti karte hain. Unhe ek hi ghar ke do alag-alag darwazon ke roop mein socho.

dematAccount.title: The Demat Account: Aapka Digital Vault
dematAccount.p1: Ek Demat Account (Dematerialized Account ka short form) aapke securities ke liye ek digital vault ya bank account jaisa hai. Physical share certificates rakhne ke bajaye, aapke stocks, bonds, mutual funds, aur dusre investments ek electronic (dematerialized) format mein rakhe jaate hain.
dematAccount.purpose: Uddeshya: Apne investments ko securely hold karna.
dematAccount.analogy: Analogy: Yeh woh locker hai jahan aap apne financial assets store karte hain.

tradingAccount.title: The Trading Account: Aapka Marketplace Access
tradingAccount.p1: Ek Trading Account stock exchanges (jaise NSE aur BSE) se aapka link hai. Yeh woh account hai jise aap actually stocks aur dusri securities ke liye buy aur sell orders place karne ke liye use karte hain.
tradingAccount.purpose: Uddeshya: Transactions (buy aur sell orders) execute karna.
tradingAccount.analogy: Analogy: Yeh woh shopping cart hai jise aap financial supermarket mein items khareedne ya bechne ke liye use karte hain.

howTheyWork.title: Woh Ek Saath Kaise Kaam Karte Hain
howTheyWork.step1: Step 1: Aap apne Trading Account ke through ek 'buy' order place karte hain.
howTheyWork.step2: Step 2: Funds aapke linked bank account se le liye jaate hain.
howTheyWork.step3: Step 3: Shares stock exchange par khareede jaate hain.
howTheyWork.step4: Step 4: Khareede gaye shares safekeeping ke liye aapke Demat Account mein deposit kiye jaate hain.
howTheyWork.sellProcess: Bechne ka process ulta hai: aap apne Trading Account se bechte hain, aur shares aapke Demat Account se nikal liye jaate hain.

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
keyTakeaways.item1: Indian stock market mein invest karne ke liye aapko Demat aur Trading Account dono ki zaroorat hai.
keyTakeaways.item2: Ek Demat Account aapke shares ko electronically HOLD karta hai.
keyTakeaways.item3: Ek Trading Account aapke buy aur sell orders ko EXECUTES karta hai.
keyTakeaways.item4: Aajkal zyada tar brokers ek convenient 2-in-1 account offer karte hain jo dono ko combine karta hai.

the-different-players-in-the-market.title: The Different Players in the Market

using-key-financial-ratios-eps-p/e-p/b-r.title: Zaroori Financial Ratios ka istemal (EPS, P/E, P/B, ROE)
using-key-financial-ratios-eps-p/e-p/b-r.description: Numbers mein chupi kahaniyon ko unlock karein. Yeh lesson aapko company ki health, profitability, aur value evaluate karne ke liye char sabse powerful financial ratios ka istemal karna sikhayega.
using-key-financial-ratios-eps-p/e-p/b-r.intro: Financial statements raw data se bhare hote hain. Iska matlab samajhne ke liye, hum financial ratios ka istemal karte hain. Yeh simple calculations hain jo hamein companies compare karne, performance analyze karne, aur informed investment decisions lene mein madad karti hain. Chalo, char zaroori ratios mein dive karte hain.

eps.title: 1. Earnings Per Share (EPS): Profitability ka Snapshot
eps.p1: Yeh kya hai: EPS batata hai ki ek company apne stock ke har share ke liye kitna profit kamati hai. Yeh per-share basis par company ki profitability ka ek fundamental measure hai.
eps.formula: Formula: EPS = (Net Income - Preferred Dividends) / Average Outstanding Shares
eps.whatItTells: Yeh aapko kya batata hai: Ek higher EPS aam taur par ek zyada profitable company ka sign hai. Isse bhi important, time ke saath EPS mein consistent growth ek strong positive sign hai.
eps.example: Agar Company A ka net income ₹10 Crore hai, koi preferred dividends nahi hain, aur 1 Crore outstanding shares hain, to uska EPS ₹10 hai.

pe.title: 2. Price-to-Earnings (P/E) Ratio: Valuation-Checker
pe.p1: Yeh kya hai: P/E ratio ek company ke current share price ko uske earnings per share se compare karta hai. Yeh sabse zyada use kiye jaane wale valuation metrics mein se ek hai.
pe.formula: Formula: P/E Ratio = Market Price per Share / Earnings Per Share (EPS)
pe.whatItTells: Yeh aapko kya batata hai: Yeh indicate karta hai ki investors ek company ki earnings ke har rupee ke liye kitna pay karne ko taiyar hain.
pe.highPe: Ek High P/E suggest kar sakta hai ki investors ko future mein high growth ki umeed hai (lekin iska matlab yeh bhi ho sakta hai ki stock overvalued hai).
pe.lowPe: Ek Low P/E indicate kar sakta hai ki ek stock undervalued hai, ya company ko challenges face karne pad rahe hain.
pe.comparison: Yeh sabse zyada useful tab hota hai jab same industry ki companies ko compare kiya ja raha ho.

pb.title: 3. Price-to-Book (P/B) Ratio: 'Net Worth' ka Multiple
pb.p1: Yeh kya hai: P/B ratio ek company ke market capitalization ko uske book value se compare karta hai. Book value ek company ki net asset value hoti hai, jo Total Assets - Total Liabilities karke calculate ki jaati hai.
pb.formula: Formula: P/B Ratio = Market Price per Share / Book Value per Share
pb.whatItTells: Yeh aapko kya batata hai: Yeh aapko samajhne mein madad karta hai ki kya aap company ke assets ki book value ke hisab se a fair price pay kar rahe hain.
pb.value: 1 se kam P/B ratio aksar ek potentially undervalued stock ka sign mana jaata hai. Yeh khas karke un companies ko value karne ke liye useful hai jinke paas significant tangible assets hain, jaise banks ya manufacturing firms.

roe.title: 4. Return on Equity (ROE): Efficiency ka Engine
roe.p1: Yeh kya hai: ROE measure karta hai ki ek company ka management shareholders ke paise ka kitna effectively profits generate karne ke liye istemal kar raha hai.
roe.formula: Formula: ROE = Net Income / Total Shareholder Equity
roe.whatItTells: Yeh aapko kya batata hai: Ek higher ROE suggest karta hai ki company apne equity base se profit generate karne mein zyada efficient hai.
roe.consistency: Kai saalon tak ek stable aur high ROE dekho. Ek consistently high ROE (jaise, 15-20% se upar) aksar ek quality company ki pehchan hoti hai.

summaryTable.title: Quick Comparison Table
summaryTable.pbRule: 1 se kam value indicate kar sakta hai.
summaryTable.roeRule: Consistently high ek accha sign hai.

takeaways.title: Key Takeaways
takeaways.item1: EPS aapko ek company ke per-share profit ke baare mein batata hai.
takeaways.item2: P/E Ratio aapko yeh samajhne mein madad karta hai ki kya ek stock apni earnings ke relative overvalued ya undervalued hai.
takeaways.item3: P/B Ratio stock price ko company ki book value se compare karta hai, jo asset-heavy industries ke liye useful hai.
takeaways.item4: ROE batata hai ki ek company shareholder investments se kitna accha profit generate kar rahi hai.
takeaways.item5: Koi ek ratio poori kahani nahi batata. Ek complete picture ke liye unhe ek saath istemal karein.

the-principle-of-portfolio-diversificati.title: Portfolio Diversification ka Siddhant
the-principle-of-portfolio-diversificati.description: Investment ka sabse important rule seekhein: 'Apne saare ande ek hi tokri mein mat rakho.' Yeh lesson samjhata hai ki risk ke against aapka best defense diversification kyun hai.

whatIsDiversification.title: Portfolio Diversification Kya Hai?
whatIsDiversification.content: Portfolio diversification ek investment portfolio ke overall risk ko kam karne ke liye various assets mein invest karne ki strategy hai. Core idea simple hai: "Apne saare ande ek hi tokri mein mat rakho." Alag-alag asset classes, industries, aur geographical regions mein investments spread karke, aap kisi ek single investment mein kharab performance ke impact ko minimize kar sakte hain.

whyDiversify.title: Diversify Kyun Karein?
whyDiversify.content: Diversification ka primary goal risk manage karna hai. Ek hi economic event par alag-alag assets alag tarah se react karte hain. Example ke liye, jab stock market down hota hai, tab bond market up ho sakta hai. Stocks aur bonds dono hold karke, ek area ke losses ko doosre area ke gains se offset kiya ja sakta hai, jisse time ke saath ek zyada stable portfolio value milti hai.

typesOfRisk.title: Risk ke Prakar
typesOfRisk.systematic: Systematic Risk: Yeh market-wide risk hai jo sabhi investments ko affect karta hai aur diversification ke through eliminate nahi kiya ja sakta. Examples mein interest rate changes, inflation, aur political instability shamil hain.
typesOfRisk.unsystematic: Unsystematic Risk: Yeh kisi particular company ya industry ke liye specific hai. Examples mein ek company ki kharab earnings report ya ek naya regulation jo kisi specific industry ko affect karta hai, shamil hain. Diversification unsystematic risk ko kam karne mein highly effective hai.

howToDiversify.title: Apne Portfolio ko Kaise Diversify Karein
howToDiversify.assetClasses: Across Asset Classes: Apne investments ko alag-alag type ke assets mein allocate karein, jaise ki stocks, bonds, real estate, aur commodities.
howToDiversify.withinAssetClasses: Within Asset Classes: Stocks ke andar, alag-alag size ki (large-cap, mid-cap, small-cap) aur various sectors (technology, healthcare, finance, etc.) ki companies mein invest karein.
howToDiversify.geographic: Geographic Diversification: Kisi ek economy mein downturn ke impact ko kam karne ke liye alag-alag countries ki companies mein invest karein.

diversificationExample.title: Ek Simple Diversification Example
diversificationExample.intro: Imagine karein aapke paas invest karne ke liye ₹10,000 hain.
diversificationExample.undiversified: Undiversified Portfolio: Aap saare ₹10,000 ek hi tech stock mein invest karte hain. Agar woh stock kharab perform karta hai, to aapka poora investment risk mein hai.
diversificationExample.outro: Is diversified scenario mein, tech sector mein ek downturn ka aapke overall portfolio par bahut kam impact padega.

bottomLine.title: The Bottom Line
bottomLine.content: Diversification sabhi investors ke liye ek fundamental concept hai. Yeh losses ke against guarantee nahi deta, lekin yeh risk manage karne aur long term mein zyada consistent returns achieve karne ke liye ek crucial tool hai.

the-investor's-mind-managing-psychologic.title: The Investor's Mind: Managing Psychological Biases
